content: equation for the sleeve set up 2 equations 1 for desired size of bottom of sleeve 1 for desired size of top of sleeve the difference in stitches is how many total stitches you have to increase throughout the sleeve panel divide the difference by 2 to get amount of stitches increased per side of sleeve panel posted for free only on ravelry ©copyright gia giaetcetra 2025 2 *if you make this sleeve section bigger or smaller moss stitch section must be started with an even number mine is 14 at each end in order to maintain moss pattern during kfb increases *note kfb increases can only be worked every 2 6 10 14 row etc in order to maintain moss stitch pattern they must be worked on rs row when the first and second stitch are both k stitches if you change sleeve panel measurements maintain increases to this pattern front body cast on 121 stitches on us 7 4 5mm needles leave a long enough tail to sew up the body and sleeve at the end ~59 in/ 150 cm starting on ws complete 4 row stockinette row 1 purl across row 2 knit across starting on ws complete 6 row of 1x1 ribbing row 1 p1 k1 end with p1 row 2 k1 p1 end with k1 the first and last stitch for the entire panel is stockinette k on rs p on ws because it will be mattress stitched at the end switch to us 9 5 5mm needle starting on ws moss stitch sections and chart a will now be worked i put stitch markers in between the following sections 24 sts moss stitch 23 sts cable pattern 27 sts diamond pattern 23 sts cable pattern 24 sts moss stitch * note moss stitch sections are not included in chart a so you can add or subtract stitches to fit your measurements continue chart a for 133 total row 143 total row including bottom stockinette/rib portion on next rs row knit 47 sts in pattern bind off 27 sts knit 47 sts in pattern next work neckline using written instructions below chart b posted for free only on ravelry ©copyright gia giaetcetra 2025 3 right shoulder as worn ws knit in pattern until 3 sts k2tog p1 rs k1 ssk slip 1 st onto cable needle and hold at front k2 from left needle k1 from cable needle cont in pattern ws cont in pattern until 3 sts ssp slip 1 as if to purl slip1 as if to knit purl both together through back loop rs k1 ssk cont in pattern ws cont in pattern no decreases rs k1 ssk cont in pattern ws cont in pattern no decreases rs k1 ssk cont in pattern 6 sts have been decreased complete 4 more row in pattern with no decreases bind off 41 sts on ws row leave a long enough tail to sew up the shoulders at the end ~20 in/ 51 cm left
